intro: Cissus landuk, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by edible, fig-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found growing on rocks or trees. Its ability to climb and its ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for gardens and indoor spaces.
